items.sentence: Do you think that Tom would really want to do that?
Do you think that you can do that without any help?
How do you take your coffee, with or without sugar?
You can ask Tom yourself tomorrow when you see him.
You didn't say anything to Tom about that, did you?
Tom would've probably given me a ride if I'd asked.
I was afraid that something like that would happen.
Have you ever wished that you were a better person?
I'm afraid we don't have time to do that right now.
Tom shares his apartment with three other students.
It's possible that Tom came here when he was a boy.
It's possible that Tom came here when he was young.
Beaches in Hawaii are famous for their large waves.
You're the most beautiful woman in the whole world.
You're going to come up against fierce competition.
I've been trying to convince Tom to move to Boston.
I'm not sure if it's Tom that I should worry about.
I'm looking forward to hearing what Tom has to say.
I'm afraid that I can't finish this report on time.
I'm sure that Tom will do what he promised he'd do.
